Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression, the rear shows one row of basketry coil, at the side impressions of further plant material. The fine brown Nile clay has few inclusions of mica and was hardened after excavation. At the front one almost complete impression of a scarab-like seal is visible as well as the edge of a second one. The seal shows a circumferential band and a standing gazelle, facing to the right.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
